bibl.title: ”Brothers“ and ”Sisters“ in documentary Papyri and in Early Christianity
bibl.note: A short version of this paper was presented at the SBL Annual Meeting 1999 in Boston/USA. This augmented version is based on a presentation during a seminario for the "Dottorato di ricerca in Studi religiosi: scienze sociali e studi storici delle religioni" at the University of Bologna in February, 2001. - Presents several examples for the different metaphorical uses of "brother": 1. Officials; - 2. Friends; - 3. Business partners; - 4. Members of Roman guilds and mystery cults (?); - 5. Conclusions.
